TopicTitle: Allow user created-saves for use by Revert Flight

Articles.Content:
We've all had those missions where we screw something up bad real deep into it and the vehicles get destroyed. The most frustrating part is now we have to spend a whole bunch more time launching another vehicle. So I thought why not add user-created saves for use by the Revert Flight button?

I know that there are ways around many human errors like just using MechJeb for everything or click Space Center while the vehicle is still moving after a fatal crash. But using the Space Center loophole relies on the autosave which is iffy; sometimes you lose 30 minutes of progress while other times you only lose 5 seconds and can't avoid your error one way or the other. And using MechJeb is just boring and limits to user experience to just building the vehicle. I reserve MechJeb for ludicrously hard stuff like rendezvous but for everything else I like to pilot manually - its more fun and a whole lot more satisfying when something works.

Like for instance when I set a lander down 11.8 meters from another lander all manual. I was proud of myself for rivaling the accuracy and precision of a computer-controlled descent.

So quick saves - yes good idea? Or, no part of Kerbal is living with your mistakes?

The game already has a Quick Save/Load feature. F5 to save, hold F9 to load.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
So it does. Sorry for my ignorance.
it's tha lack of a proper toutrial on quicksaves that causes that.
